XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.ushell.ui.appfinder.AppBox
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ui/appfinder/AppBox. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getSubtitle subtitle} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : string
    • {@link #getUrl url} : string
    • {@link #getNavigationMode navigationMode} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getPinButton pinButton} : sap.m.Button
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterRendering afterRendering} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription: Add your documentation for the newui/appfinder/AppBox

XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.ushell.ui.footerbar.AddBookmarkButton
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ui/footerbar/AddBookmarkButton. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getBeforePressHandler beforePressHandler} : any
    • {@link #getAfterPressHandler afterPressHandler} : any
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getSubtitle subtitle} : string
    • {@link #getInfo info} : string
    • {@link #getTileIcon tileIcon} : string
    • {@link #getNumberUnit numberUnit} : string
    • {@link #getKeywords keywords} : string
    • {@link #getCustomUrl customUrl} : any
    • {@link #getServiceUrl serviceUrl} : any
    • {@link #getServiceRefreshInterval serviceRefreshInterval} : string
    • {@link #getShowGroupSelection showGroupSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAppData appData} : object
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Button#constructor sap.m.Button} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription: A button to be displayed in the application footer. Clicking the button opens a dialog box allowing the user to save the app state, so that the app can be launched in this state directly from the launchpad.

XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.ushell.ui.launchpad.GridContainer
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap/ushell/ui/launchpad/GridContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getGroupId groupId} : string
    • {@link #getShowHeader showHeader} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDefaultGroup defaultGroup} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIsLastGroup isLastGroup} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getHeaderText headerText} : string
    • {@link #getHeaderLevel headerLevel} : sap.m.HeaderLevel (default: H2)
    • {@link #getGroupHeaderLevel groupHeaderLevel} : sap.m.HeaderLevel (default: H4)
    • {@link #getShowGroupHeader showGroupHeader} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHomePageGroupDisplay homePageGroupDisplay} : string
    • {@link #getIsGroupLocked isGroupLocked} : boolean
    • {@link #getIsGroupSelected isGroupSelected} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEditMode editMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowBackground showBackground} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : string (default: sap-icon://locked)
    • {@link #getShowIcon showIcon} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableHelp enableHelp} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTileActionModeActive tileActionModeActive} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIeHtml5DnD ieHtml5DnD} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowEmptyLinksArea showEmptyLinksArea} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowEmptyLinksAreaPlaceHolder showEmptyLinksAreaPlaceHolder} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSupportLinkPersonalization supportLinkPersonalization} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTileSizeBehavior tileSizeBehavior} : string (default: TILE_SIZE_BEHAVIOR.RESPONSIVE)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getTiles tiles} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getLinks links} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getBeforeContent beforeContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getAfterContent afterContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getFooterContent footerContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getHeaderActions headerActions} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:afterRendering afterRendering} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:titleChange titleChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:tileDragStart tileDragStart} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:tileDragEnter tileDragEnter} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:tileDrop tileDrop} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:layoutChange layoutChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription: A container that arranges Tile and Card controls.

XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ToolAreaItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getSelected selected} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getAriaLabel ariaLabel} : string
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getExpandable expandable} : boolean (default: false)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:expand expand} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.ushell.components.factsheet.controls.PictureTile
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new components/factsheet/controls/PictureTile. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 32px)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 32px)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getTileContent tileContent} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ushell.components.factsheet.controls.PictureViewerItem)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:pictureDelete pictureDelete} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.CustomTile#constructor sap.m.CustomTile} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 PictureTile is used in PictureViewer control and is not meant to be consumed outside of PictureViewer usage. PictureViewer was replacing the sap.m.Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.
Tile control embedding an image and allowing custom sizing

DeprecatedInfo.description: PictureTile is used in PictureViewer control and is not meant to be consumed outside of PictureViewer usage. PictureViewer was replacing the sap.m.Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.

XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.ushell.components.factsheet.controls.PictureViewer
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new components/factsheet/controls/PictureViewer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTileScaling tileScaling} : float (default: 0.95)
    • {@link #getRemovable removable} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ushell.components.factsheet.controls.PictureViewerItem[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:pictureDeleted pictureDeleted} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.TileContainer#constructor sap.m.TileContainer} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 PictureViewer was replacing the Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.
